name: Ned Lamont
tweet: I thank President Trump for his service and we are very much looking forward to working with President elect Joe Biden.He will be a great partner for our state and a great leader for our country.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: My statement on the successful election of President-elect @JoeBiden and Vice President-elect @KamalaHarris:  https://t.co/I4LnTVLSoF

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: There’s still time to go out the vote for @JoeBiden & @KamalaHarris! We are in the home stretch of this election and we need your help to elect them. Can we count on you to make calls to swing state voters in the final days? Sign up at  https://t.co/dqeccnZ9kM #GOTV @CBiden2020  https://t.co/BaEY9UxOOU

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: This morning in Meriden, I rallied w/ #Democrats to ensure we re-elect and elect @JahanaHayesCT, @SenatorAbrams, @RepAbercrombie, Rep. Santiago and Michael Quinn. We need to get out there and do all we can for this team—which has led on healthcare, education and fighting for you.  https://t.co/FONDE1IdjE
mentions: [{'screen_name': 'jahanahayesct', 'name': 'jahana hayes', 'id': '991721030631780354'}, {'screen_name': 'senatorabrams', 'name': 'state senator mary daugherty abrams', 'id': '1003654938818482176'}, {'screen_name': 'repabercrombie', 'name': 'cathy abercrombie', 'id': '770707442309169153'}]

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Up next is a canvass kickoff with my good friend Congressman @jahimes in support of @StephanieforCT. Stephanie is just the kind of representative we need—a small business owner who has dedicated her career to nonprofits and helping those in need. @WiltonDems @NorwalkCTDems #vote

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: With #ElectionDay only 10 days away, I’ll be spending the weekend continuing to help out candidates that we really need to send back to Washington or Hartford—starting this morning at 9:30am in Norwalk with my good friend Rep @lucydathan! @NorwalkCTDems #Election2020

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Sen. @KamalaHarris making us proud tonight and showing why the #BidenHarris ticket will put science first when addressing the COVID pandemic—just as we have here in CT. #VPDebate ￼

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: While firefighters are protecting our families, we need a President who is committed to protecting ours--and that's @JoeBiden. He has the courage we respect and the commitment to working Americans we need now. Connecticut is so proud to cast our 75 votes for Joe Biden!  https://t.co/1nIvL2SRRf

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Sen. @KamalaHarris is a true leader, and the kind of person that will be incredible for our country by the side of my good friend @JoeBiden. I proudly support the Biden-Harris ticket! #BidenHarris2020

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: To join and RSVP, please visit:  https://t.co/AX7Sul9mlm

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Family is everything on the campaign trail. I wouldn’t have been succcessful without my incredible wife @annielamont—that’s why she’s joining Dr. @Jillbiden46 & New Jersey First Lady @TammyMurphyNJ this afternoon to help @JoeBiden get across the finish line! Tune in today at 5pm.  https://t.co/91Veezqsjn

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: @ctnewsjunkie Hey Christine, “can’t go anywhere?“ Actually you can go To any state with a relatively low infection rate, which is the vast majority of states. That said, Connecticut has the lowest infection rate and it’s pretty nice in July, just sayin’.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: @Chris_Meloni @GovNedLamont And great to have Chris Meloni back in town :-)

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: @eloisa_melendez Go Eloisa, Always in the arena fighting for what she believes

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Now that’s my kind of #JoeMentum! Congratulations to my good friend and the next President, @JoeBiden on a super #SuperTuesday! You proved again why you are the best candidate to unite our country and that our brightest days are still ahead.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: The towns of Mansfield, Windham, Lebanon and Colchester are fortunate to have a champion dedicated to improving education and creating economic development opportunities. @SusanForCT and I look forward to getting to work this session.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Congratulations to Representative-elect @BrianSmithCT on an incredible victory. Brian will be a strong voice for the 48th district and carry on the legacy and dedication of Linda Orange. Through hard work, his message of advocating on behalf of families and small businesses won.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: @RepJahanaHayes @GovNedLamont Jahana, after my inaugural party I received thousands of tweets from people begging me never to dance in public again. They would never say the same for your jolly team, many thanks see you soon and Time marches on

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: .@JoeBiden’s positive and optimistic outlook for our country is just what we need now more than ever.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: This may change after Sunday night! #JoeBiden

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Always proud to welcome my good friend former Vice President @JoeBiden to our great state along with a packed house of supporters. With Joe, you get a leader who puts our country first every day and believes our brightest days are still ahead. 🇺🇸😎🌞  https://t.co/WzN1AFQVv1

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: As Democrats, we are fortunate to have such an impressive field. The strength of our candidates is good for our democracy and for us as a nation. Joe has spent his entire life fighting for hard working American families. That’s the kind of President we need now more than ever.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: When my campaign needed a final push last fall, @JoeBiden was there. I’ve gotten to know him more over the years and now, I’m grateful that he’s thrown his hat in the ring to run against President Trump.  https://t.co/F8mFoYqYvB

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: I am so proud to be your Governor, and we are just getting started!  A few highlights from my remarks at the John Bailey Dinner. The full clip is posted at  https://t.co/TaorjyzaOI  https://t.co/1SIOXcT8JT

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: The Office of Governor Ned Lamont’s official Twitter account is @GovNedLamont. Please give it a follow and join us for the start of our new administration.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Excited to take office tomorrow and be in “The Room Where It Happens.” #InaugurationDay #Hamilton  https://t.co/KtNToo57uc

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: We cannot say thank you enough to the hundreds of volunteers who stepped up today and who step up every day to improve the lives of our state’s most vulnerable. The stories we heard today about helping those in need are why I’m so proud to be your next governor.  https://t.co/2clkp8Bktj

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: So many came together with @SusanForCT and I to join in today’s #DayofService in #Newington at @cthumane, including @SenBlumenthal, Rep. Guerrera, Rep. Lopes, Rep-elect Turco and Rep-elect Wood. Be sure to stop in and adopt a pet today!  https://t.co/bUiGSR2zh7

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Our #DayofService continued at the Home for the Brave in #Bridgeport and VA in West Haven. Thank you to all the veterans for your service and volunteers for what you do to help.  https://t.co/Ism8wTSynu

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Rolling up our sleeves, throwing on a hairnet and kicking off our #DayofService at New Covenant in Stamford. Incredible to see such volunteerism in action from so many in our state.  https://t.co/xNqJzV4Xh7

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Always good to join @DennisHouseTV. Please be sure to tune in Sunday morning 8:30am on @WFSBnews to hear how @SusanForCT and I plan to turn this state around. #inauguration  https://t.co/u9OmpSyLzF

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Turning 64 was liberating but turning 65 today is even more exciting. Looking forward to becoming Connecticut’s next governor in just under a week. #bestpresent

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: I encourage everyone across the state to join me in serving their communities and celebrating the work that non-profit organizations do to help those in need throughout the year. Join me this Sun., January 6 for a “Day of Service.” Learn more by visiting  https://t.co/6yJIxSY8ju

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Free on January 9th? Please join me for my inauguration and attend the inaugural ball as we celebrate with a “Taste of Connecticut.” For more information and to purchase tickets, visit  https://t.co/RX07GNwWqx. Don’t forget your dancing shoes.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: This of all seasons is a time to look out for one another. We are one big family here in Connecticut. Non-profits & organizations like @foodshare are amazing by serving millions of meals. Let's do all we can to make sure everyone has the happiest holiday season. Donate today.  https://t.co/CjptHTf9nh

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Today, our state and country remember the innocent lives lost at Sandy Hook School. No words can describe the loss of these children and educators. No sense can be made of something so utterly senseless. Annie and I are keeping all of the victims’ families in our thoughts today.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: ICYMI: 500 new jobs coming to Stamford as Indeed expands here in Connecticut.   https://t.co/WtsR1RhLy6

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: It was an honor to help officially welcome @Infosys to Hartford this week. They’re up and running in their new offices, working with @trinitycollege and CT employers to make sure our workforce is trained for Connecticut’s 21st century jobs.   https://t.co/sajlCmNHsj

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: I encourage additional insurers to follow Travelers' lead in helping CT residents repair their homes. As Gov, I will work with private-sector partners who want to do the right thing so we can continue to provide support to those who need it & have been made to wait for too long.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Homeowners with crumbling foundations have the opportunity to seek relief through the Travelers Benefit Program. Just visit this link or call 800-527-2416.  link:  https://t.co/ClW1X67awc

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: I applaud Travelers for stepping up to partner with the state to help solve the growing crumbling foundations crisis. This has been a worst nightmare for families in northeastern CT and Travelers is showing leadership that others should emulate.   https://t.co/bEOE7o3vx8

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Ryan Drajewicz shares my commitment to building an administration that is dynamic, entrepreneurial, & inclusive. As Chief of Staff, he will be my partner in leading the Governor’s Office, hiring excellent staff, and staying true to our core mission of a CT that works for everyone

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: I am impressed by Melissa McCaw's background and professional accomplishments, deep dedication to the future success of our state, and optimistic vision for Connecticut. She will be an exceptional Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management.     https://t.co/QLaIZpP4Fb

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: As American politics takes a particularly rough turn, we will all miss and should always remember George H.W. Bush, Connecticut’s native son, a kinder and gentler time, marked by courage and wisdom and service.  My full statement:  https://t.co/H2fXxMssuj

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: 5G is coming. CT can lead the way.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: New, emerging industries and the success of Connecticut’s traditional businesses are both essential to economic growth.   https://t.co/M48t7yYrmA

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Connecticut cities have always been hubs of innovation. It’s exciting to see the work being done to bring new startups to Hartford to continue that tradition in the 21st century. #selectiondays2018   https://t.co/PBQVyAD6LE

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: For news and information about the transition, please visit  https://t.co/KXLoSuNxGF

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: We’re hitting the ground running. The policy committees met today at ECSU to get input and talk about how to move CT forward    https://t.co/b6JwKSbto3

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: @bwparker Good morning. The website is  https://t.co/NIiL9SZtVf Thank you for your interest. — staff

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Connecticut is an incredible place to live because of the strength of our communities. Thankful to share this holiday season with others. Have a happy and safe #Thanksgiving Weekend, everyone.  https://t.co/i6E4zZiGWn

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Thank you for your partnership, Mayor.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: The individuals I've asked to join my transition's Steering Committee come from the private sector, non-profits, and government — and they come from both sides of the aisle. We're a small state, and we're all in this together.   https://t.co/gXckm2txoD

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: I also met with the mayors of our five largest cities: Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Hartford, and Waterbury. I am going to work with mayors and First Selectmen, business leaders, legislators, and labor to jumpstart our economy and create good jobs with good wages across CT.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Yesterday, I met with ten of CT's largest employers: Aetna, Boehringer Ingelheim, Cigna, Electric Boat, The Hartford Financial Services, Sikorsky, Stanley Black & Decker, Travelers, UTC, & Webster Bank to discuss economic growth and solving the fiscal crisis.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Connecticut ranks third on USA Today’s list of best states to live in. Great schools and universities, quality health care, and safe neighborhoods add up to excellent quality of life.  Working together, we can put CT where it belongs — at #1.    https://t.co/q35nkRcl38

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Today marks the 10th anniversary of Connecticut’s first same-sex marriages. While we celebrate this milestone along the path to full equality, let’s commit our state to advancing civil rights and remaining a national model for equal treatment of all.  https://t.co/07Q9VtrTdj

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Honoring the sacrifices our heroes have made in the name of freedom is the very core of Veterans Day.  Thank you all for the endless bravery and courage you displayed while fighting to protect our freedom.  https://t.co/3PSufexthA

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: Thank you to all of Connecticut’s veterans, and to their families, for their sacrifice and dedication to our nation and its ideals. On #VeteransDay and every day, we are grateful and honor your service.

name: Ned Lamont
tweet: In New London today, I met with business and community leaders to work on spurring economic development in eastern Connecticut.    https://t.co/MfhojU0vkZ
